Research Themes: Articles examined through the systematic review provide a comprehensive view of cognition through research conducted at the level of the individual, the organisation and within the general population, see Table 2 below. Although all results have been provided summarised within the table, only the themes relating to the individual level cognition will be discussed in depth below, in keeping with the research question to examine managerial decisions linked to climate change. Research themes identified in the articles were:
Factors Shape Cognition
Cognition Shapes Decisions/ Action
Cognitive Factors Shape Action
Cognition Shapes Frame
Cognitive Framing Shapes Decisions
Cognitive Frames Enable Sensemaking
